question: Which country has launched the world's smallest and cheapest private jet "Vision Jet"?
explanation: Cirrus Aircraft, the US-based aviation company, has launched the worldâ€™s smallest and cheapest private jet \'Vision Jet\' at Rs.12.6 Crore. The Jet can haul five adults up to 1,150 miles at 28,000 feet. It is the first Private Jet with a single engine and can be conveniently operated by a single pilot, thus keeping production and maintenance costs low for the users. The jet can fly at a speed of 345mph and has an operating altitude of 28,000 feet.
